entry.title: test vcf_reader
entry.summary:
once you get a virtualenv set up and pyvcf installed, you can work with vcf files:

import vcf

with open('F0--R0.vcf') as vcf_reader:
for record in vcf_reader:
print(record)
entry.content:
once you get a virtualenv set up and pyvcf installed, you can work with vcf files:

import vcf

with open('F0--R0.vcf') as vcf_reader:
for record in vcf_reader:
print(record)
